meanings.definition: An official order or proclamation issued by a person in authority.
meanings.sent1: The king's edict demanded all citizens to attend the royal ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The mayor issued an edict requiring everyone to wear masks in public places.
meanings.sent3: The edict from the principal stated that all students must wear silly hats on Fridays.
meanings.sent4: Her edict to ban junk food in the house was met with rebellion from her siblings.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's edict to complete the assignment by Monday echoed in the classroom.

meanings.sent1: The emperor's edict declared a new holiday for the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The judge's edict ordered the immediate release of the prisoner.
meanings.sent3: The edict from the coach required all players to wear mismatched socks during practice.
meanings.sent4: His edict to always speak the truth was a guiding principle in his life.
meanings.sent5: The CEO's edict to increase productivity inspired the employees to work harder.
